column1: Severe Psoriasis that is Resistant to Treatment
column2: marine1967, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been on it less than a month and my insurance company would not give me the daily dose my Dr suggests, but it seems to be working anyway.  I am noticing severe chapped lips (when I never got them in the past) and a troubling change in the taste of food. And not a change for the good either. But, this is the last option for me.  We have tried everything else and either they didn;t work or the side effects were so severe I couldn;t tolerate them. Sooo, hopefully I can get use to the side effects of Soriatane Oral because, as I said above, it does seem to be working.

column1: Severe Psoriasis that is Resistant to Treatment
column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have had severe psoriasis since I was 11-affecting about 95% of my body & psoriatic arthritis since 16..After yrs of topicals & other meds,Soriatane has been the most effective for me.The side effects are awful.I lost almost all of the hair on my head(which was down the middle of my back), 60% of my eyebrows&eyelashes & haven't needed to shave my legs ever since I started the meds.My nails split, my clear areas of skin are fragile, my lips chap horribly, the inside of my nose is raw and my heels peel horribly and hurt. Not to mention so many other side effects that go along with it.However, my psoriatic arthritis has benefited greatly. I am still in pain, but it is at a tolerable level. My psoriasis has cleared to where I can actually feel comfortable wearing short sleeves or a dress (no turtlenecks in the summer!). My insurance has always covered the medication, although the copay has ranged from $30 - $110.Everything is not for everybody. I DON'T recommend Soriatane, but it does work for me. If anyone plans on using this, I would strongly suggest doing a great deal of research. I was not emotionally or physically prepared for the side effects. My hair has grown back to where I don't need a wig, but it has never returned to how it was before and is very thin. My psoriasis still goes through different cycles and stages, but it is manageable. Over the years, my dosage has varied from 25mg to 40 mg/day. I actually began on 50mg, which cleared my skin in a week 1/2, but then I felt like I'd been severely sunburned for weeks after and my dosage was reduced.There have been several months during this treatment that I have chosen not to use it, but then ended up in severe pain again.I do the best I can with it, my topicals are limited now because this works and I will probably continue it as long as my monthly labs stay ok.

column1: Skin Disease Characterized by Swollen Itching Lesions
column2: Rudy, 45-54 on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have had mild hand eczema most of my life untill about a year ago when it turned severe,90% of my hands were cracked peeling & very painfull.My dermitologist prescribed Soriatane for me 25mg daily  for the last 4 months & it has really worked well for me.It took about 3 months to take effect but my hands are the best the have been in over a year & my monthly bloodwork so far is good.In the first couple of months of the treament the improvement was negligable but the last month has been amazing,I know there is risks in using this medication but it is nice to be able to tie my shoes & go to work without excruciating hand pain.

column1: Severe Psoriasis that is Resistant to Treatment
column2: ladyjane, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I started with 1 pill a day and by the 3rd day and I had a terrific headache, skin was peeling, burning, itching. Doc said to wait 3 days & then take pill every 3rd day. By the 2nd. pill my head felt like it would explode. Pain in the left eye, fingernails broke off, skin continued to peel, burn, itch. Stopped meds. After 2 weeks of headaches and eye pain went to eye doc. Medication had caused dry spots on my eye surface. Doesn't know if they will go away.Painful at times. Headaches continue. Psoriasis is better tho ! Not gone, but better.  It now just looks rashy and itches.I go for my blood test Thursday to see if there is any liver damage and can't wait to hear that good news ! NO MORE SORIATANE for me. The cure is worse than the disease.

column1: Severe Psoriasis that is Resistant to Treatment
column2: Lou, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I first used Acetretin generic which had no contraindications for the use of alcohol attached.  I was using alcohol while on the meds and my triglicerides went up. I was asked to stop taking it. 3 months later I started again after non-alcohol consumption for 3 months and got Soriatane - non-generic and viewed entire pamphlete. I may have to wait 5 years to be able to donate blood/kidney.  My plaque psoriasis was on every limb and torso, front and back. Now, 3 months after using soriatane, I finished taking the meds and 95% of the plaque is gone. Leaving some darkened patches where plaque was.  My lips dried during medication period. And, palms and sole of feet dried, too.  Urine tended to smell slightly (as in high protein consumption). My lips went back to normal after two weeks and after four weeks no return of plaque to date. I tried to do UV-B light treatment while taking meds. First attempt - I was exposed for 6 minutes. I am olive skinned and take the sun well. The 6 minutes caused 1st degree burn to exposed areas and I peeled after 3 days. 3 months later I tried UV-B again and asked to tone down light strength by 2/3. I managed that UV-B fine with some tanning and went 3 times. That assisted the meds well. Better treatment than the next phase, Enbrel. I feel Enbrel is too much of a risk.  Using diet and weight training to boost metabolism and maintain optimum immune system function.
